DialogEntry.Dialog: You look really busy! Is there anything I can do to help out?
I suppose. Could you scan through these files for me and look for anything on competitive trends?
Sure, no problem!
Thanks. That's nice of you.
I bet if we supported each other, we'd both get our work done a lot quicker.
That's a nice offer. Let me think about it, ok?
I think we'd work well together.
I'll get back to you on this.
Why don't we collaborate on a project together?
No offense, but I work better on my own.
If that's the way you want it.
I appreciate the offer.
There's no reason we can't BOTH make it through Management Training together.
We both know there's only one open Management spot!
Well, if you land the spot, maybe you'll recommend me when the next one comes up.
I must say, I like your attitude!
There's no reason we can't BOTH make it through Management Training together.
I think it is obvious I'm going to get the spot.
You don't know that for sure.
Oh, I think I've pretty much got a lock on it!
If this is a war, let the best man win!
You mean let the best WOMAN win!
I meant what I said.
We'll see what you say when you end up reporting to me!
You're clearly not up to the pressure around here.
Who the hell do you think you're talking to?
I'm just making an observation.
You better watch what you say, unless you want me to report you to HR!
You're clearly not up to the pressure around here.
That's it. I've had it!
What do you mean?
You're bullying me and I intend to report you to HR!
I want you to keep an eye on Susan for me.
What do you mean? You want me to spy on her?
That's exactly what I want you to do. Find examples of her incompetence-- or you'll face the consequences. Understand?
Yes, I understand. You expect me to spy on her for you-- or else.
If you like working, you better choose sides.
You mean choose YOUR side.
Only if you want to stay on the team.
You're not leaving me any options, so-- yes. I want to be on YOUR team, ok?
Now that I'm in charge, there are going to be some changes.
I thought there might be.
While you aren't qualified for an executive position, I can offer you an admin role-- as my secertary. What's your answer?
But... fine. My answer is... yes.
Now that I'm in charge, there are going to be some changes.
I thought there might be.
I'm sorry. but your services are no longer required. Your employment is terminated, effective immediately.
I never thought this would happen to me!
You must be finding it difficult to make ends these days.
You know I make a lot less now than I was before you demoted me!
Lucky for you, I've reserved you a room in the Secretarial Dormitory. You can move in immediately.
I'm going to miss my apartment. Yes, I'll begin packing tonight.
Nice to meet you!
So, you're the new guy? Welcome to Artemis.
It's great to be here.
Sure, sure. See you around.
I can't help but admire how driven you are!
I've always been this way. I got my MBA from Forbes. Where did you go to business school?
I didn't. I don't have an MBA.
If you don't make it through the Management Trainee Program, maybe I can find a spot for you under me.
Are you from around here?
No. I grew up a few hours from here.
Any brothers or sisters?
A younger sister-- Katherine. We're not really that close though.
I think we both know why you're here. It is high time someone put you in your place.
You have a hell of a nerve!
From now on, you're going to do as you're told-- or I'll make sure you never work in corporate again!
Fine-- you win. For now.
You seem upset with me.
I am! Don't think I haven't heard about why you're saying about me!
You're being paranoid.
Am I? I don't think so!
You seem upset with me.
I am! Don't think I haven't heard about why you're saying about me!
You're being paranoid.
Am I? I don't think so!
I've had it with you! Your stiff necked attitude towards me is unacceptable!
Let me go! You have no right--
As your manager, I have every right to send you here! When you're released, I suspect you'll return to your duties with a far better attitude towards authority!
Please! Don't leave me here! Please! I'm sorry-- I'll do whatever you want!
Hey there, pretty girl.
Is there something you need?
Coffee and a blowjob would be nice. Can you handle that, Sweetie?
Yes, of course. I'll be right back with your coiffee.
Hi! I'm the new guy.
I'm Britney-- Britney Bower. I'm the Receptionist.
I look forward to working with you.
You better go to Ms. Granger's office. She's been expecting you.
Do you live near the office?
Like I could afford it on my salary! The rents around here are insane!
So you have a bit of a commute?
The only good thing about Botany Bay Housing project is that it is on the bus line!
Do you like being the receptionist?
Are you for real? Getting hit on by couriers and doing all the shit work they can throw at me?
So you're looking at it as entry level?
I know I'll never be an executive-- but I think I could still go far by hooking up with one. At work, I mean.
You're one of the best things about working here.
Am I really? I wish other people thought that.
It's true. You really brighten this place up.
Maybe I could say the same thing about you!

Interaction.Name: Promise to make her your secretary

DialogEntry.Dialog: I expect I'll be taking on more responsibilities soon.
Good for you! I hope it works out for you.
I'm going to need a girl I can count on.
You can count on me! That's the kind of opportunity I've been looking for!
From now on, you'll be reporting to me. Understand?
I guess so.
Not good enough. Try again.
I'll be reporting to you from now on... Sir.
You're fired Britney.
Why? What did I do? Why are you firing me?
Because I can. I'm not having some dog faced slut as a receptionist in my department!
You bastard! You can go straight to hell!
Skinny cappucino, right?
For me? What a nice surprise!
I figured you're the one usually getting the coffees around here and it was time someone reciprocated.
I don't know what to say! You're so nice!
Hey, can I ask you a personal question?
Sure, I suppose so.
I was just wondering if you were seeing anybody.
Well, not at the moment!
Damn. how did we get so lucky to have such a hottie as our receptionist?
That's kind of fresh, you know.
Maybe-- but it's worth getting in trouble to work with such a fox like you.
You better get out of here before I really do report you for harassment!
Damn. how did we get so lucky to have such a hottie as our receptionist?
Look, that's not appropriate.
What are you going to do?
I'm going to report this!
What say we grab some lunch together?
Sorry-- I'm broke until pay day.
Let me treat you.
Wow-- ok!
What say we grab some lunch together?
I'm not sure I'm ready for that.
Come on-- don't be such a tease.
That's it! I'm calling HR!
Anne must get a lot of messages when she's out on the road.
I take more for Ms. Millert than anyone else.
From now on, you'll forward her messages ort me. I'll make sure she gets them.
Whatever you say!
I'm interested in anything that comes in for Deborah Jones.
Like mail and stuff?
Exactly. You'll pass it all on to me.
Of course.
It would be a shame if Susan missed any calls, especially from Management.
I always let her know when she gets a call from senior managers.
Not any more.
No-- not any more.
Good-- that's exactly the right look for you!
It seems a little too casual.
More like a little too slutty, but I'm sure male visitors will have no objections.
That's for sure.
Do you like it?
It's a dog collar!
Nonsense-- it is a choker. You really need one.
It still looks like a dog collar to me!

Interaction.Name: Insist she send you a slutty selfie

DialogEntry.Dialog: Come on-- I know you like me. Take a selfie and show me what you've got.
It's just that these pix can get you in trouble if they get out.
Yes, but if show loyalty, you get loyalty back.
Well, when you out it that way...

Interaction.Name: Order her to record a masturbation vid

DialogEntry.Dialog: You're not seriously telling me you don't play with yourself?
What does that have to do with making a dirty video for you?
Because I want to see you show me how much you think of me when I'm not around.
OK-- but you have to promise never to show it to anyone else!

Interaction.Name: Brag about how easy she is in public

DialogEntry.Dialog: Britney's got a great attitude.
You might even say she's a bit of a suck up.
She loves working under a manager who knows how to handle her.
She's flexible and always ready to bend over backwards to keep her manager happy!
I'm pleased with your progress. You've become a superb 'deceptionist' office spy for me.
I'm just doing what you tell me to do.
Which is exactly the way it is going to be from now on. You understand?
Yes, I understand. You're the boss from now on.
Ready for Game Day?
I feel kind of silly!
No, you just look like you are very excited about the Championship game.
I thought I had graduated high school already!
Let's go. Flip up that skirt and show me something sexy.
What if someone sees me?
I guess they'll just think the receptionist is being a slut, as usual.
But I'm really not!
Let's go. Flip up that skirt and show me something sexy.
What if someone sees me?
I guess they'll just think the receptionist is being a slut, as usual.
But I'm really not!
Stop squirming. You look great.
Everyone's been looking at me!
Spare me. You love it when you get attention.
But not like this!
I approve. You look like a beach bunny cocktease.
It barely covers me!
True-- but since you're a "But-her-face", that's the whole idea.
That's such a mean thing to say!
Do you live near the office?
Like I could afford it on my salary! The rents around here are insane!
So you have a bit of a commute?
The only good thing about Botany Bay Housing project is that it is on the bus line!
Would you mind if I joined you on some sales calls?
I'm better on my own.
I was hoping to learn from you. Everyone sayes you're the best sales person in the company.
Alright-- but keep your comments to yourself!
Would you mind if I joined you on some sales calls?
I'm better on my own.
I was hoping to learn from you. Everyone sayes you're the best sales person in the company.
Alright-- but keep your comments to yourself!
Can we keep making sales calls together? I'm learning so much!
I'm not paid to tutor you.
I'll follow your lead completely. Please?
Oh, alright. Just as long as I get credit for the sales.
Can we keep making sales calls together? I'm learning so much!
I'm not paid to tutor you.
I'll follow your lead completely. Please?
Oh, alright. Just as long as I get credit for the sales.
I think you'll find that Comp Plan issue fixed.
No way. I've been fighting that for months!
I used a little juice to get it sorted.
You're a useful man to know!
From now on, you'll be getting the marketing support you've been asking for.
I very much doubt that.
Doubt all you like-- you'll get everything on your wish list. I used a favour with Marketing.
Damn-- you really do have some juice around here!
Susan's an impediment.
You mean she's in your way. Look, I'm planning on leaving soon. Just leave me alone and I'll drop a poison pill on her for you on my way out.
I'm a fan. You have nothing to worry about from me. But, if we had a deal...
We have a deal. Believe me, I've been dying to drop the dirt on how incompetent Susan is. I'm getting married and don't need this job anymore.
Are you the Sales Manager for CSG?
I'm the lead sales exec. Who are you? Oh, the new kid- right?
I'm in the Management Trainee Program.
Good for you. You do know this is the company’s dumping ground, don’t you?
Do you have a minute?
Not really. What do you want?
I was just hoping you could tell me--
I'm on my way to a sales call. Maybe later, ok?

Interaction.Name: Do you have a long commute?

DialogEntry.Dialog: Do you have a long commute?
I’m over in Tempo Townhouses. Great place-- my unit has gone up twenty percent since I bought it!
Sounds like a great investment!
Work hard and maybe you'll get there too.

Interaction.Name: Who’s who in the zoo around here?

DialogEntry.Dialog: Who’s who in the zoo around here?
Zoo is right. CSG is a mess.
Why is that?
You'll figure it out pretty quickly. Maybe we'll chat leter.
Are you ok?
Please leave me alone.
What's the matter?
I don't feel right! Something's wrong!
I heard they are really turning up the heat on you.
That witch Granger has doubled my sales goal!
Why would she do such a thing?
She's desperate to keep her own job, that's why!
You don't look happy.
Susan just stole half my key clients and decided they were 'house accounts'!
That's not fair! You worked hard to build up those accounts!
I sure as hell did. It's just outright theft.
I'm sorry about this. These new rules are just crazy!
You damn well better keep it safe.
Of course. Your engagement ring will be kept under lock and key. No one will be able to steal it.
It just seems over the top but at least the company is trying to protect my property.
I thought I'd better let you know about this before the word gets out.
This is so humiliating. You have to keep this between us.
I'll try. What will you do now?
The engagement is over. Beyond that, I don't know what to do. This changes everything.
Considering what a disaster you've turned out to be, you think you'd be grateful for a second chance.
What do you mean?
I mean you work for me from now on. You'll do as say-- or I'll have you terminated.
No need for that. I'll do what you want.
You knew this day would come.
Wait-- what do you mean??
I mean you're done here. I have no further use for you.
You use me-- then toss me away? Just like that?
